title: `rustc` keep crashing while `cargo expand`ing big file

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: requires-nightly
labels.description: This issue requires a nightly compiler in some way.

body:
### Code The code is really big (3k lines & I have no idea how to minimize it.... (though, most of it is a comment)). Here is a [playground link](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=60ea0401357c0afc121c9c5d6f5e37e6). (p.s. the code is totally wrong, a was experimenting....) ### Meta ``` rustc 1.46.0-nightly (ff5b446d2 2020-06-23) // playground rustc 1.46.0-nightly (6bb3dbfc6 2020-06-22) // local ``` ### Error output ``` Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground) thread 'rustc' panicked at 'assertion failed: `(left == right)` left: `2772`, right: `1`', src/librustc_ast_pretty/pprust.rs:441:17 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports note: rustc 1.46.0-nightly (ff5b446d2 2020-06-23) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -Z unstable-options -C embed-bitcode=no -C codegen-units=1 -C debuginfo=2 --crate-type bin ```
Backtrace

(I couldn't turn on the backtrace in the playground, so the backtrace is local) ``` stack backtrace: 0: backtrace::backtrace::libunwind::trace at /cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/backtrace-0.3.46/src/backtrace/libunwind.rs:86 1: backtrace::backtrace::trace_unsynchronized at /cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/backtrace-0.3.46/src/backtrace/mod.rs:66 2: std::sys_common::backtrace::_print_fmt at src/libstd/sys_common/backtrace.rs:78 3: ::fmt at src/libstd/sys_common/backtrace.rs:59 4: core::fmt::write at src/libcore/fmt/mod.rs:1076 5: std::io::Write::write_fmt at src/libstd/io/mod.rs:1537 6: std::sys_common::backtrace::_print at src/libstd/sys_common/backtrace.rs:62 7: std::sys_common::backtrace::print at src/libstd/sys_common/backtrace.rs:49 8: std::panicking::default_hook::{{closure}} at src/libstd/panicking.rs:198 9: std::panicking::default_hook at src/libstd/panicking.rs:217 10: rustc_driver::report_ice 11: std::panicking::rust_panic_with_hook at src/libstd/panicking.rs:477 12: rust_begin_unwind at src/libstd/panicking.rs:384 13: std::panicking::begin_panic_fmt at src/libstd/panicking.rs:338 14: rustc_ast_pretty::pprust::PrintState::print_comment 15: rustc_ast_pretty::pprust::State::print_stmt 16: rustc_ast_pretty::pprust::State::print_block_maybe_unclosed 17: rustc_ast_pretty::pprust::State::print_item 18: rustc_ast_pretty::pprust::print_crate 19: rustc_driver::pretty::print_after_hir_lowering::{{closure}} 20: rustc_driver::pretty::print_after_hir_lowering 21: rustc_middle::ty::context::tls::enter_global 22: rustc_interface::queries::::enter 23: rustc_span::with_source_map 24: rustc_interface::interface::run_compiler_in_existing_thread_pool 25: scoped_tls::ScopedKey::set ```
